SENT.plain: Idiopathic hypertrophic cranial pachymeningitis is a rare inflammatory disease with diffused involvement of the dura
Often, the definite diagnosis is made immediately with biopsy and the involved dura is removed surgically
Consequently, extensive preoperative imaging studies usually are not available
We reviewed a case of idiopathic hypertrophic cranial pachymeningitis and collectively summarized the interesting features from the 7 years preceding surgical treatment

These chronologic imaging findings with progressive intracranial involvement included dural thickening, dural mass, sinus thrombosis, and venous congestion constituted comprehensive pictures of idiopathic hypertrophic cranial pachymeningitis
The thickened dura may also at times mimic dural masses, such as en plaque meningioma
